info.description: Use the Invoicing API to create, send, and manage invoices. You can also use the Invoicing API or webhooks to track invoice payments.
info.title: PayPal InvoicesAPI

post.description: Lists invoices that match search criteria. If you pass multiple criteria, the response lists invoices that  match all criteria. A successful request returns the HTTP 200 OK status code and a JSON response body that  lists the invoices that match the search criteria.

Creates a draft invoice. To move the invoice from a draft to payable state, you must send the invoice.  In the JSON request body, include invoice details including merchant information. The invoice object must  include an items array.

get.description: Lists merchant invoices. To filter the invoices that appear in the response, you can specify one or more  optional query parameters. A successful request returns the HTTP 200 OK status code and a JSON response body  that lists invoices with details.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The zero-relative start index of the entire list of merchant invoices that are returned in the response.  So, the combination of page=0 and page_size=20 returns the first 20 invoices.The combination of page=20 and  page_size=20 returns the next 20 invoices.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of invoices to return in the response.

parameters.name: total_count_required
parameters.description: Indicates whether the to show the total count in the response.

get.description: Shows details for an invoice, by ID. A successful request returns the HTTP 200 OK status code and a JSON  response body that shows invoice details.

put.description: Fully updates an invoice, by ID. In the JSON request body, include a complete invoice object. This call does  not support partial updates. A successful request returns the HTTP 200 OK status code and a JSON response  body that shows invoice details.

parameters.name: notify_merchant
parameters.description: Indicates whether to send the invoice update notification to the merchant.

delete.description: Deletes draft invoices. You can cancel invoices that you have already sent. After you delete a draft invoice,  you can no longer use it or show its details. However, you can reuse its invoice number. A successful request  returns the HTTP 204 No Content status code with no JSON response body.

post.description: Sends an invoice, by ID, to a customer. To suppress the merchant's email notification, set the notify_merchant  query parameter to false. A successful request returns the HTTP 202 Accepted status code with no JSON response  body.

parameters.name: notify_merchant
parameters.description: Indicates whether to send the invoice update notification to the merchant.

post.description: Sends a reminder to the payer about an invoice, by ID. In the JSON request body, include a notification object  that defines the subject of the reminder and other details.  A successful request returns the HTTP 202 Accepted  status code with no JSON response body.

Cancels a sent invoice, by ID, and, optionally, sends a notification about the cancellation to the payer,  merchant, and CC: emails. A successful request returns the HTTP 204 No Content status code with no JSON response  body.
Marks the status of an invoice, by ID, as paid. A successful request returns the HTTP 200 OK status code  with no JSON response body.
Marks the status of an invoice, by ID, as refunded. A successful request returns the HTTP 200 OK status code  with no JSON response body.

get.description: Generates a QR code for an invoice, by ID. The QR code is a PNG image in Base64-encoded format that corresponds  to the invoice ID. You can generate a QR code for an invoice and add it to a paper or PDF invoice. When  customers use their mobile devices to scan the QR code, they are redirected to the PayPal mobile payment flow  where they can view the invoice and pay online with PayPal or a credit card. Before you generate a QR code, you must (1) Create an invoice. (2) Send an invoice to move it to the 'payable' state.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width, in pixels, of the QR code image. Value is from 150 to 500.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height, in pixels, of the QR code image. Value is from 150 to 500.

post.description: Generates the next invoice number that is available to the merchant. The next invoice number uses the prefix  and suffix from the last invoice number and increments the number by one. For example, the next invoice number  after INVOICE-1234 is INVOICE-1235. A successful request returns the HTTP 200 OK status code and a JSON response  body that shows the next invoice number.

number.description: The invoice number. If you omitted this value from the request, the default is the auto-incremented number from the last number.

image.description: QR code as a PNG image in base-64-encoded format

email.description: The initial letters of the email address.

recipient_first_name.description: The initial letters of the recipient's first name.

recipient_last_name.description: The initial letters of the recipient's last name.

recipient_business_name.description: The initial letters of the recipient's business name.

number.description: Any part of the invoice number.

status.description: The invoice status. To search by status, specify this value as an array. For example, "status": ["REFUNDED"].

lower_total_amount.description: The lower limit of the total amount.

upper_total_amount.description: The upper limit of total amount.

start_invoice_date.description: The start date for the invoice, in Internet date and time format. For example, yyyy-MM-dd z.

end_invoice_date.description: The end date for the invoice, in Internet date and time format. For example, yyyy-MM-dd z.

start_due_date.description: The start due date for the invoice, in Internet date and time format. For example, yyyy-MM-dd z.

end_due_date.description: The end due date for the invoice, in Internet date and time format. For example, yyyy-MM-dd z.

start_payment_date.description: The start payment date for the invoice, in Internet date and time format. For example, yyyy-MM-dd z.

end_payment_date.description: The end payment date for the invoice, in Internet date and time format. For example, yyyy-MM-dd z.

start_creation_date.description: The start creation date for the invoice, in Internet date and time format. For example, yyyy-MM-dd z.

end_creation_date.description: The end creation date for the invoice, in Internet date and time format. For example, yyyy-MM-dd z.

page.description: The zero-relative start index of the entire list of merchant invoices to return in the response. So, a  combination of page=0 and page_size=20 returns the first 20 invoices. A combination of page=20 and  page_size=20 returns the next 20 invoices.

page_size.description: The page size for the search results.

total_count_required.description: Indicates whether the response shows the total count.

archived.description: Indicates whether to list merchant-archived invoices in the response. If true, response lists only  merchant-archived invoices. If false, response lists only unarchived invoices. If null, response lists all  invoices.

total_count.description: The total number of invoices that match the search criteria.

links.description: HATEOAS links related to this call.

subject.description: The subject of the notification. If left blank we include a generic subject.

send_to_merchant.description: Indicates whether to send the notification to the merchant.

send_to_payer.description: Indicates whether to send the notification to the payer.

cc_emails.description: An array of one or more CC: emails. If you omit this parameter from the JSON request body, a notification  is sent to all CC: email addresses that are part of the invoice. Otherwise, specify this parameter to limit  the email addresses to which a notification is sent.

subject.description: The subject of the notification. Default is a generic subject.

send_to_merchant.description: Indicates whether to send a copy of the email to the merchant.

cc_emails.description: An array of one or more CC: emails to which notifications are sent. If you omit this parameter, a notification  is sent to all CC: email addresses that are part of the invoice.

href.description: The URL of the related HATEOAS link that you can use for subsequent calls.

rel.description: The link relationship. Describes how this link relates to the previous call. For example, use a self link to  show details for the current call. Use a parent_payment link to show details for the parent payment. The rel  value can also be a related call, such as execute or refund.

method.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call.

name.description: The name of the attached file.

url.description: The URL of the attached file. Use this URL to download the file.

created_date.description: The date and time when the resource was created, in Internet date and time format.

created_by.description: The email address of the account that created the resource.

cancelled_date.description: The date and time when the resource was canceled, in Internet date and time format.

cancelled_by.description: The actor who canceled the resource.

last_updated_date.description: The date and time when the resource was last edited, in Internet date and time format.

first_sent_date.description: The date and time when the resource was first sent, in Internet date and time format.

last_sent_date.description: The date and time when the resource was last sent, in Internet date and time format.

last_sent_by.description: The email address of the account that last sent the resource.

payer_view_url.description: The URL for the payer's view of the invoice.

type.description: The PayPal refund type. Indicates whether the refund was paid through PayPal or externally in the invoicing  flow. The record refund method supports the EXTERNAL refund type. The PAYPAL refund type is supported for  backward compatibility.

transaction_id.description: The ID of the PayPal refund transaction. Required for the PAYPAL refund type

date.description: The date when the invoice was refunded, in Internet date and time format. For example, 2014-02-27 PST.

note.description: A note associated with the refund.

type.description: The payment type in an invoicing flow. The record refund method supports the EXTERNAL refund type. The PAYPAL  refund type is supported for backward compatibility.

transaction_id.description: The ID for a PayPal payment transaction. Required for the PAYPAL payment type.

date.description: The date when the invoice was paid, in Internet date and time format. For example, yyyy-MM-dd z.

number.description: The invoice number. If you omit this value, the default is the auto-incremented number from the last number.

status.description: The invoice status. When you search for invoices, specify this value as an array. For example, "status": ["REFUNDED"].

billing_info.description: The billing information for the invoice recipient.

invoice_date.description: The invoice date as specificed by the sender, in Internet date and time format. For example, yyyy-MM-dd z.

reference.description: The reference data, such as PO number.

allow_partial_payment.description: Indicates whether the invoice allows a partial payment. If false, invoice must be paid in full. If true,  the invoice allows partial payments.

tax_calculated_after_discount.description: Indicates whether the tax is calculated before or after a discount. If false, the tax is calculated before  a discount. If true, the tax is calculated after a discount.

terms.description: The general terms of the invoice.

note.description: A note to the invoice recipient. The note also appears on the invoice notification email.

merchant_memo.description: A private bookkeeping memo for the merchant.

logo_url.description: The full URL to an external logo image. The logo must not be larger than 250 pixels wide by 90 pixels high.  The logo must be stored on a secure server.

attachments.description: The file that is attached to an invoice or template.

allow_tip.description: Indicates whether the invoice enables the customer to enter a tip amount during payment. If true, the invoice  shows a tip amount field so that the customer can enter a tip amount. If false, the invoice does not show a  tip amount field.

template_id.description: The template ID. This value is used to determine the layout of the invoice, such as which fields to show and hide.

links.description: HATEOAS links related to this call.

term_type.description: The term when the invoice payment is due.

due_date.description: The date when the invoice payment is due, in Internet date and time format. For example, yyyy-MM-dd z.

percent.description: The discount as a percentage value. Value is from 0 to 100. Supports up to five decimal places.
The tax rate. Value is from 0 to 100. Supports up to five decimal places.

currency.description: The three-letter ISO 4217 alphabetic currency code.

value.description: The currency value. Might be an integer for currencies like JPY that are not typically fractional or a decimal  fraction for currencies like TND that are subdivided into thousandths. For the required number of decimal  places for a currency code, see ISO 4217.

quantity.description: The item quantity. Value is from -10000 to 10000. Supports up to five decimal places.

date.description: The date when the item or service was provided, in Internet date and time format. For example, yyyy-MM-dd z.

unit_of_measure.description: The unit of measure for the invoiced item. For AMOUNT the unit_price and quantity are not shown on the invoice.

email.description: The email address of the person who receives a copy of the invoice.

first_name.description: The first name of the recipient at the shipping address.

last_name.description: The last name of the recipient at the shipping address.

business_name.description: The business name of the recipient at the shipping address.

email.description: The invoice recipient email address. If you omit this value, the invoice is payable and a  notification email is not sent.

language.description: The language in which the invoice recipient's email appears. Used only when the recipient does not have a  PayPal account. If you omit the language and the recipient does not have a PayPal account, the email is sent  in the language of the merchant's PayPal account.

additional_info.description: Any additional information about the recipient.

country_code.description: The country code portion of the phone number, in E.164 format.

national_number.description: The in-country phone number, in E.164 format.

country_code.description: The two-character ISO 3166-1 code that identifies the country or region.

phone.description: A phone number. Must be represented in its canonical international format, as defined by the E.164 numbering plan.

email.description: The merchant email address. This email must be listed in the merchant's PayPal profile. If you omit this  value, notifications are sent from and to the primary email address but do not appear on the invoice.

additional_info.description: Any additional information, such as business hours.

number.description: The invoice number. If you omit this value, the default is the auto-incremented number from the last number.

billing_info.description: The billing information for the invoice recipient.

invoice_date.description: The invoice date as specificed by the sender, in Internet date and time format. For example, yyyy-MM-dd z.

reference.description: The reference data, such as PO number.

allow_partial_payment.description: Indicates whether the invoice allows a partial payment. If false, invoice must be paid in full. If true,  the invoice allows partial payments.

tax_calculated_after_discount.description: Indicates whether the tax is calculated before or after a discount. If false, the tax is calculated before  a discount. If true, the tax is calculated after a discount.

tax_inclusive.description: Indicates whether the unit price includes tax.

terms.description: The general terms of the invoice.

note.description: A note to the invoice recipient. The note also appears on the invoice notification email.

merchant_memo.description: A private bookkeeping memo for the merchant.

logo_url.description: The full URL to an external logo image. The logo must not be larger than 250 pixels wide by 90 pixels high.  The logo must be stored on a secure server.

allow_tip.description: Indicates whether the invoice enables the customer to enter a tip amount during payment. If true, the  invoice shows a tip amount field so that the customer can enter a tip amount. If false, the invoice does  not show a tip amount field.

template_id.description: The template ID. This value is used to determine the layout of the invoice, such as which fields to show and hide.
